gurmukhi: sjy ssqR AsqRM ciVE caup cwXM ]
transliteration: Saje Sastra Astran Chadio Chaoup Chaayan||
translation: He, in fury and excitement, marched forward to wage war, bedecking himself with arms and amour.

gurmukhi: BXo nwd aucM rhXo pUr gYxM ]
transliteration: Bhayo Naad Ouchannd Rahyo Poor Gadnan||
translation: There was terrible sound which permeted in the firmament.
Hearing this sound, the gods, demons and Shiva all trembled.1.157.

gurmukhi: firE cwr bkqRM tirE dyv rwjM ]
transliteration: Dario Chaar Baktran Tatio Dev Raajan||
translation: Brahma was fightened and the throne of Indra, the king of gods, wavered.

gurmukhi: ifgy p`b srbM sRjy suBR swjM ]
transliteration: Dige Pabh Sarban Sraje Soubhra Saajan||
translation: Seeing the bedecked form of the demon-king, the mountains also began to fall.

gurmukhi: pry hUr dY kY Bry loh kRohM ]
transliteration: Dare Hooh Dai Kai Ddare Loh Krohan||
translation: Shriking and screaming in great ire the demons appear;

gurmukhi: mno myr ko swqvO siRMg sohM ]2]158]
transliteration: Mano Mer Ko Saatvau Sring Sohan||2||158||
translation: Like the seventh peak of Sumeru mountain.2.158.

gurmukhi: sjXo sYx suMBM kIXo nwd au`cM ]
transliteration: Sajyo Sain Sounbhan Kooyo Naad Ouchchannd||
translation: Bedecking himself, Sumbh raised a terrible sound;
Hearing which the pregnancy of women was miscarried.

gurmukhi: pirE loh kRohM auTI ssqR JwrM ]
transliteration: Pario Loh Krohan Outhoo Sastra Jhaaran||
translation: The furious warriors made continuous use of steel arms and the weapons began to rain.
The voices of vultures and vampires were heard in the battlefield.3.159.

gurmukhi: bhy ssqR AsqRM kty crm brmM ]
transliteration: Bade Sastra Astran Kate Charam Barman||
translation: With the use of weapons and arms, the winsome armours were being cut;

gurmukhi: Bly kY inbwihE BtM suAwim DrmM ]
transliteration: Bhale Kai Bibaanhio Bhatan Suaam(i) Dharman||
translation: And the warriors performed their religious duties in a nice manner.

gurmukhi: auTI kUh jUhM igry caur cIrM ]
translation: There was consternation in the whole battlefield and the canopies and garments began to fall.
